definition: to advance courageously (idiom)/to press forward
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: While people brood , time skips ahead without looking back.
sentences.chinese: 人猶猶豫豫，時間卻一往無前。

sentences.english: This army has an indomitable spirit.
sentences.chinese: 這個軍隊有一往無前的精神。

sentences.english: Because of a friend's help and encouragement, you will be invincible and indomitable.
sentences.chinese: 因爲朋友的相助和激勵，你纔會戰無不勝，一往無前。

sentences.english: Our duty as men is to proceed as if limits to our ability did not exist.
sentences.chinese: 我們人類的職責是一往無前，無視能力之極限。

sentences.english: Courage is the discovery that you may not win, and trying when you know you can lose.
sentences.chinese: 勇氣，就是明知自己可能會輸，卻還是一往無前。

sentences.english: Is it the courage to act with conviction?
sentences.chinese: 是堅定信念後一往無前的勇氣？

sentences.english: Stepping forth the cure For soul's demise.
sentences.chinese: 爲了治癒魂靈的死亡而一往無前。

sentences.english: "To-morrow, " he said at parting, a gayety of manner adding wonderfully to his brave demeanour.
sentences.chinese: 他的歡樂的情緒使他一往無前的氣概更加瀟灑。

sentences.english: The New York Stock Exchange and the Nasdaq are still powering ahead.
sentences.chinese: 新的紐約證券交易所和納斯達克仍然是一往無前。

definition: cheerful/happy
to follow through/to carry through to the end
to be strongly determined to succeed (idiom)
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
lit. to be confined within a circle drawn on the ground (idiom)/fig. to confine oneself to a restricted range of activities
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
willingly and gladly (idiom)
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
enterprising spirit/initiative
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
to use one's brains/to think
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
selfless/impartial
